channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: President Donald Trump, under fire over his administration's response to the surging coronavirus crisis in the US, says he will resume holding briefings on the pandemic after a lengthy hiatus.
item.title: Trump to resume coronavirus briefings as US cases surge

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: British scientists have made a breakthrough in the race to find a coronavirus vaccine, with the first round of human trials showing the shot induces a strong immune response.
item.title: Oxford coronavirus vaccine triggers strong immune response, trial shows

item.description: The Canadian rugby league team cited "overwhelming financial challenges" caused by the coronavirus pandemic as the reason for the team's withdrawal.
item.title: Sonny Bill Williams' Toronto Wolfpack withdraws from Super League restart

item.description: This year's Twenty20 World Cup, which was scheduled to begin in Australia in October, has been postponed because of the pandemic, the ICC said.
item.title: T20 World Cup in Australia postponed due to COVID-19

item.description: Heard told Britain's High Court that Depp blamed his actions on "a self-created third party" that he referred to as "the monster".
item.title: Amber Heard tells court she feared Johnny Depp would kill her

item.description: Australia's limited-overs tour to England is set to go ahead in September, with the touring party likely to fly to the UK on a private charter plane.
item.title: Australia to fly to England on chartered plane for rearranged limited-overs tour

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: The first national assessment of the damage wrought by the unprecedented summer bushfires finds there is likely to be a dramatic increase in the number of species facing wipeout.
item.title: Summer 'mega-fires' push more native animals towards extinction

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: Researchers say thousands of jobs could be created in large-scale renewable energy schemes, ecosystem restoration and the processing of organic waste.
item.title: Thousands of 'clean jobs' could tackle COVID unemployment slump

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, July 21

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 21, 2020

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Less than two weeks out from the competition start, players say they are having to reschedule their university degrees and inform employers of the 11th-hour move.
item.title: Netballers give up part-time work, study to keep season alive

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Paul Green is gone with 18 months to go in his Cowboys contract but with at least two clubs looking for a new coach, his name is already featuring prominently.
item.title: Green's Cowboys exit adds fresh intrigue to coach carousel

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The revenue figure was revealed in a question on notice submitted to Parliament by the LNP.
item.title: Speed camera revenue soars as almost 1 million drivers are caught

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: We’ve been told many times the ever-growing population of the Earth will end in catastrophe.
item.title: The world is heading for a population crisis but not the one it was expecting

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW is unlikely to return to full lockdown, although several senior ministers are keen for restrictions to be tightened.
item.title: Tighter restrictions and masks more likely than full lockdown

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The take-up of the governments's first SME loan guarantee scheme was woeful. Take two may not be much better.
item.title: Tottering small businesses need more than another loan guarantee scheme

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: The boss of Whispir, the platform used for Victoria’s troubled contact tracing system, says the delays in the system have nothing to do with the company's technology.
item.title: Whispir defends COVID-19 contact tracing as delays plague system

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: People with taxable incomes over $180,000 have a median super balance worth $152,229 more than those in the next tax bracket, and the gap is growing.
item.title: Growing super gap fuels calls to cut tax concessions for high earners

item.dc:creator: Nick Talley
item.description: If we want to avoid another lockdown, social distancing on its own is not enough.
item.title: How NSW can stop the virus dead in its tracks

item.description: Shutting the door on Victoria might have happened earlier had the Premier not been so strident about keeping borders open.
item.title: Obstinacy on open border closed door to good sense

item.description: In the last few years more than 70 parks and green canopies have been destroyed or threatened.
item.title: New ideas are all very well, but Sydney's green spaces need some old-fashioned protection

item.description: A woman told my brother she didn't need to wear a mask because she was 'Australian'.
item.title: Why we shouldn’t see face masks as an 'Asian thing'

item.dc:creator: Ella Archibald-Binge
item.description: Legal experts, doctors and justice groups are calling for governments to change laws that imprisoned almost 600 children aged 10 to 13 last year.
item.title: 'A quicksand that traps these kids': Push to raise age of criminal responsibility from 10 to 14

item.description: Depending on who you asked, Sydney's Monorail was either an exciting innovation or an expensive eyesore.
item.title: From the Archives, 1988: Sydney vs. the Monorail

item.dc:creator: Lyn Maccallum
item.description: Men on moon, New party launched, Third of beauties
item.title: In the Herald: July 21, 1969

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Actor Geoffrey Rush is set for a final win over Sydney’s Daily Telegraph after his titanic defamation fight.
item.title: Telegraph in no Rush to appeal $2.87m defamation payout

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: The interpretation of holding the ball has been a hot topic in recent weeks with the AFL tightening the adjudication.
item.title: Be careful, Saints coach urges AFL, as debate over holding the ball rages

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Opposition research shows the Premier's infrastructure deal with China is a loser with voters in Labor-held state seats.
item.title: Liberals to hammer Andrews on 'dodgy Belt and Road deal' all the way to 2022

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Some Victorians with life threatening symptoms waited more than 12 hours before seeking hospital treatment during the first lockdown in a dangerous trend doctors fear could cost lives amid current surge.
item.title: 'Huge concern:' Heart attack patients risk lives by delaying hospital treatment

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: A Victorian mask manufacturer says it is operating around-the-clock to fulfil its contract to boost the Commonwealth stockpile and has no capacity to meet increased public demand.
item.title: Mask demand crashes websites, creates shortage of elastic

item.description: It has taken months, but research clearly indicates that masks reduce transmission of the coronavirus by as much as 85 per cent.
item.title: Masks are not a panacea but are the step we needed to take

item.description: Splashing cash on big movie companies is inflationary and harms local producers.
item.title: Screen me up, Scotty - or dish up some movie millions closer to home

item.description: It came down to some finer points of high-end cooking and it was a very close-run thing, but the MasterChef champion for 2020 has been crowned.
item.title: MasterChef Australia 2020: A throwback finale for the cooking show juggernaut's 12th series

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: St Kilda have snuck into the first XI. The Saints entered Monday night’s meeting with the Crows having lost all 10 of their previous matches at Adelaide Oval.
item.title: Saints survive scare to break Adelaide Oval duck

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Millions of workers on the JobKeeper wage subsidy will keep getting it until March, but the rate will be lower than the $1500 a fortnight currently available.
item.title: JobKeeper will be extended until March but split into two tiers

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: JobKeeper has done its job, a Treasury report has found, but warns it has to change as its current form encourages zombie businesses and jobs.
item.title: Australia will be left with zombie firms without JobKeeper change: Treasury

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: A young woman who has been in hotel quarantine since returning to Tasmania from Victoria has broken Tasmania's two-month streak of no coronavirus cases.
item.title: Tasmania records first COVID-19 case in more than two months

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Two Paddington venues have been added to the growing list of places people have visited while unknowingly infectious. Another two NSW clusters have doubled in size.
item.title: Person in 30s with COVID-19 in intensive care as NSW Premier considers restrictions

item.description: Plant and animal species in Australia are becoming extinct as fast as ever. Why is it happening? And what would it take to reverse the decline?
item.title: Tablet interactive: Why is Australia a global leader in wildlife extinctions?

item.description: Please refrain from any pointed comments.
item.title: You are now entering the Packerstan Protectorate

item.dc:creator: Gary Adshead
item.description: Technology expert Trevor Long said he was stunned to see highly-sensitive medical details "flying around" on an unsecured network.
item.title: 'Unforgivable': The privacy breach that exposed sensitive details of WA's virus fight

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: Follow the action live as St Kilda and the Crows close out round seven.
item.title: Live AFL scores: Adelaide v St Kilda

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Dogs are being trained to locate fox dens in an effort to help biodiversity.
item.title: Sniffer dogs save time in finding fox dens near SEQ dams

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Restrictions on the NSW-Victoria border region will be tightened from midnight Tuesday, after Victoria recorded 363 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, its second-highest daily case total.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Victoria records 275 new COVID-19 cases as state makes face masks mandatory; NSW COVID-19 clusters grow as Australian death toll jumps to 123

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Buildings required to progress through the state program need to have done so by May next year - 24 government sites have been found to feature the flammable material.
item.title: Almost 3000 private buildings yet to be cleared of cladding concerns

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Shane Tuck had the difficulty of following an illustrious father, who up until four years ago had played in more games than any other footballer in the competition's history.
item.title: Shane Tuck: football royal who did it the hard way

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Magistrate Graeme Curran was convicted of indecently assaulting a teenage boy in the 1980s. Two of his convictions were quashed on appeal, with others upheld.
item.title: 'No reasonable doubt' about Curran's guilt on five charges, appeal court finds

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Kieran Foran remains an outside chance to overcome a toe injury in time for Sunday's road trip to Newcastle as he eyes a one-year Canterbury extension.
item.title: 'I'm not after mammoth dollars': Foran keen to stay with Bulldogs

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Premier Daniel Andrews says while he was happy to report a lower daily number on Monday, it was too early to say if things had turned around.
item.title: A dozen schools from Toorak to Drysdale closed as COVID-19 spreads
